Types of Dyslexic Adults [different ways to grow into dyslexia] (video)

Many learning differences such as ADHD and Autism can impact a person's ability to develop literacy skills. One learning difference that dramatically impacts a person's literacy development is dyslexia. Dyslexia is a developmental disorder that presents with difficulties mapping letters to sounds, and causes problems with reading and writing, including with comprehension and fluency. Dyslexia often goes untreated or undiagnosed. Some adult learners with dyslexia have developed compensatory skills in reading, while others may continue to demonstrate difficulties with foundational literacy skills (Bell, 2010). While it is not your job to diagnose dyslexia, sharing resources and the experiences of those with dyslexia may help adult learners seek assistance and understand their learning experiences in new ways. 

Additional Resource: CAEL, Overcoming Barriers for Adult Learners
